declarations.comments:
The `Arbitrary` class represents those types whose values can be
_randomly-generated_.

`arbitrary` uses the `Gen` monad to express a random generator for
the type `t`. Combinators in the `Test.QuickCheck.Gen`
module can be used to construct random generators.
declarations.title: Arbitrary

declarations.comments:
The `Coarbitrary` class represents types which appear on the left of
an `Arbitrary` function arrow.

To construct an `Arbitrary` instance for the type `a -> b`, we need to
use the input of type `a` to _perturb_ a random generator for `b`. This
is the role of the `coarbitrary` function.

`Coarbitrary` instances can be written using the `perturbGen` function.
declarations.title: Coarbitrary

declarations.comments:
A seed for the linear congruential generator. We omit a `Semiring`
instance because there is no `zero` value, as 0 is not an acceptable
seed for the generator.
declarations.title: Seed

declarations.comments: Create a random seed
declarations.title: randomSeed

modules.name: Test.QuickCheck
modules.comments:
This module is a partial port of the Haskell QuickCheck library.

QuickCheck provides a way to write _property-based_ tests.

The `Arbitrary` and `CoArbitrary` type classes allow us to create
random data with which we can run our tests. This module provides
instances of both classes for PureScript's core data structures,
as well as functions for writing new instances.

Test suites can use the `quickCheck` and `quickCheckPure` functions
to test properties.

For example:

```purescript
main = quickCheck \n -> n + 1 > n
```

declarations.comments: A type synonym which represents the effects used by the `quickCheck` function.
declarations.title: QC

declarations.comments:
Test a property.

This function generates a new random seed, runs 100 tests and
prints the test results to the console.
declarations.title: quickCheck

declarations.comments:
A version of `quickCheck` with the property specialized to `Gen`.

The `quickCheckGen` variants are useful for writing property tests where a
`MonadGen` constraint (or QuickCheck's `Gen` directly) is being used,
rather than relying on `Arbitrary` instances. Especially useful for the
`MonadGen`-constrained properties as they will not infer correctly when
used with the `quickCheck` functions unless an explicit type annotation is
used.
declarations.title: quickCheckGen

declarations.comments:
A variant of the `quickCheck` function which accepts an extra parameter
representing the number of tests which should be run.
declarations.title: quickCheck'

declarations.comments: A version of `quickCheck'` with the property specialized to `Gen`.
declarations.title: quickCheckGen'

declarations.comments:
A variant of the `quickCheck'` function that accepts a specific seed as
well as the number tests that should be run.
declarations.title: quickCheckWithSeed

declarations.comments: A version of `quickCheckWithSeed` with the property specialized to `Gen`.
declarations.title: quickCheckGenWithSeed

declarations.comments:
Test a property, returning all test results as a List.

The first argument is the _random seed_ to be passed to the random generator.
The second argument is the number of tests to run.
declarations.title: quickCheckPure

declarations.comments: A version of `quickCheckPure` with the property specialized to `Gen`.
declarations.title: quickCheckGenPure

declarations.comments:
The `Testable` class represents _testable properties_.

A testable property is a function of zero or more `Arbitrary` arguments,
returning a `Boolean` or `Result`.

Testable properties can be passed to the `quickCheck` function.
declarations.title: Testable

declarations.comments: The result of a test: success or failure (with an error message).
declarations.title: Result

declarations.comments:
This operator attaches an error message to a failed test.

For example:

```purescript
test x = myProperty x <?> ("myProperty did not hold for " <> show x)
```
declarations.title: withHelp

declarations.comments: Self-documenting equality assertion
declarations.title: assertEquals

declarations.comments: Self-documenting inequality assertion
declarations.title: assertNotEquals

declarations.comments:
The `Arbitrary` class represents those types whose values can be
_randomly-generated_.

`arbitrary` uses the `Gen` monad to express a random generator for
the type `t`. Combinators in the `Test.QuickCheck.Gen`
module can be used to construct random generators.
declarations.title: Arbitrary

declarations.comments:
The `Coarbitrary` class represents types which appear on the left of
an `Arbitrary` function arrow.

To construct an `Arbitrary` instance for the type `a -> b`, we need to
use the input of type `a` to _perturb_ a random generator for `b`. This
is the role of the `coarbitrary` function.

`Coarbitrary` instances can be written using the `perturbGen` function.
declarations.title: Coarbitrary

declarations.comments: A `Generic` implementation of the `arbitrary` member from the `Arbitrary` type class.
declarations.title: genericArbitrary

declarations.comments: A `Generic` implementation of the `coarbitrary` member from the `Coarbitrary` type class.
declarations.title: genericCoarbitrary

declarations.comments:
To be able to evenly distribute over chains of Sum types we build up
a collection of generators and choose between.  Each right component
of a Sum is either a Constructor or another Sum.
declarations.title: ArbitraryGenericSum

declarations.comments: A helper typeclass to implement `Arbitrary` for records.
declarations.title: ArbitraryRowList

declarations.comments:
A newtype for `String` whose `Arbitrary` instance generated random
alphanumeric strings.
declarations.title: AlphaNumString

modules.name: Test.QuickCheck.Gen
modules.comments:
This module defines the random generator monad used by the `Test.QuickCheck`
module, as well as helper functions for constructing random generators.

declarations.comments:
The random generator monad

`Gen` is a state monad which encodes a linear congruential generator.
declarations.title: Gen

declarations.comments: Exposes the underlying State implementation.
declarations.title: unGen

declarations.comments: The state of the random generator monad
declarations.title: GenState

declarations.comments:
Tests are parameterized by the `Size` of the randomly-generated data,
the meaning of which depends on the particular generator used.
declarations.title: Size

declarations.comments: Create a random generator for a function type.
declarations.title: repeatable

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which uses the generator state explicitly.
declarations.title: stateful

declarations.comments: Modify a random generator by setting a new random seed.
declarations.title: variant

declarations.comments:
Ensure that a generator only produces values that match a predicate. If
the predicate always returns false the generator will loop forever.
declarations.title: suchThat

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which depends on the size parameter.
declarations.title: sized

declarations.comments: Modify a random generator by setting a new size parameter.
declarations.title: resize

declarations.comments:
Create a random generator which samples a range of `Number`s i
with uniform probability.
declarations.title: choose

declarations.comments:
Create a random generator which chooses uniformly distributed
integers from the closed interval `[a, b]`.
Note that very large intervals will cause a loss of uniformity.
declarations.title: chooseInt

declarations.comments:
Create a random generator which selects and executes a random generator from
a non-empty array of random generators with uniform probability.
declarations.title: oneOf

declarations.comments:
Create a random generator which selects and executes a random generator from
a non-empty, weighted list of random generators.
declarations.title: frequency

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which generates an array of random values.
declarations.title: arrayOf

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which generates a non-empty array of random values.
declarations.title: arrayOf1

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which generates a list of random values of the specified size.
declarations.title: listOf

declarations.comments: Create a random generator which generates a vector of random values of a specified size.
declarations.title: vectorOf

declarations.comments:
Create a random generator which selects a value from a non-empty array with
uniform probability.
declarations.title: elements

declarations.comments: Generate a random permutation of the given array
declarations.title: shuffle

declarations.comments: Run a random generator
declarations.title: runGen

declarations.comments: Run a random generator, keeping only the randomly-generated result
declarations.title: evalGen

declarations.comments: Perturb a random generator by modifying the current seed
declarations.title: perturbGen

declarations.comments: A random generator which approximates a uniform random variable on `[0, 1]`
declarations.title: uniform

declarations.comments: Sample a random generator
declarations.title: sample

declarations.comments: Get a random sample of 10 values
declarations.title: randomSample

declarations.comments: Sample a random generator, using a randomly generated seed
declarations.title: randomSample'

declarations.comments:
A seed for the linear congruential generator. We omit a `Semiring`
instance because there is no `zero` value, as 0 is not an acceptable
seed for the generator.
declarations.title: Seed

declarations.comments: The *multiplier*: a magic constant for the linear congruential generator
declarations.title: lcgM

declarations.comments: The *increment*: a magic constant for the linear congruential generator
declarations.title: lcgC

declarations.comments:
The *modulus*: a magic constant for the linear congruential generator.
It is equal to 2^31 - 1, a Mersenne prime. It is useful for this value to
be prime, because then the requirement of the initial seed being coprime
to the modulus is satisfied when the seed is between 1 and lcgN - 1.
declarations.title: lcgN

declarations.comments: Step the linear congruential generator
declarations.title: lcgNext

declarations.comments: Perturb a seed value
declarations.title: lcgPerturb

declarations.comments: Create a random seed
declarations.title: randomSeed
